I've tried like nearly a dozen of the top-rated Pomodoro timer apps, and this one is BY FAR the most polished, complete one out of all. I'm very particular with the features that I want, and there are quite a few, and this one practically checks all of my boxes. They have tasks, tags, easy date setting, automatic start, break, and end options, aesthetically pleasing, various useful widgets, statistic tracking, all for free; the only thing the free version lacks is a repeat function for tasks.

I love this app! It can be granular, especially for people who prefer that. It breaks down tasks into more manageable subtasks, and you can manage the start/stop timer sounds, to recurring, daily tasks, and notifications for all tasks. I feel like the app is designed quite well, with one small exception; when you are picking the time you want a notification to sound, it shows as 24-hour time, but when you save it, it saves and shows it in "standard" time. Weird design, but not a deal breaker.

I found an app that has every feature I wanted! Recently, I learned about the Pomodoro technique and was looking for an app that could combine a to-do list, Pomodoro timer, and reminders‚Äîall in one. This app does it perfectly!
Perfeto

The app's intuitive interface makes it easy to start using the Pomodoro Technique right away. You can set your tasks, start the timer, and focus on your work. The app will notify you when it's time to take a break, helping you maintain a healthy work-rest balance.One of the most valuable aspects of Focus To-Do is its analytics feature. The detailed reports allow you to analyze your productivity patterns, identify areas for improvement, and track your progress over time.

Loved the app for the experience. I have noted that when comes to recurring task, the alarm set needs to be changed manually everyday. For example, I have set a recurring reminder for every Tuesday 6AM for a task, the recurring is set for one a week till 31 Dec 2025. Now I am not able to get the reminder from the second Tuesday onwards. Please fix this I will give 5 star.

It does the job but isn't under real development anymore. There's still no dark mode on PC and if you complete a recurring task, but then decide to uncomplete it (to eg. work more on it) it prevents the next day task from showing (it skips a day). It should be clearer on the task to see in a project exactly how much time was logged (not just pomodoros). In the "Completed" list it's full of spam entries for each pomodoro instead of 1 line per task with the total time and pomodoros. Needs QoL.

I'm a subscriber of this app and I really love it's simplicity and sync across devices, but there's one thing that I would change: I suffer from ADD and I'm still trying to traine my focus and discipline, so sometimes I'm not able to focus for an entire Pomodoro. Other times the Pomodoro ends and I'm still "in the zone" so I focus beyond the Pomodoro. That being said the time tracking is not very accurate because when I work more that time is not counted, and if I pause or stop the Pomodoro for an early break I tend to spend more time on the break that I should because there's no timer alerting me that is time to go back to work. Is it possible to add for example two more buttons to the current running Pomodoro? 1 for adding more time, for example a +5m like1 for stop and start counting the break ? I believe that would help a lot for people with attention disorders like ADD and ADHD
